title: The Innovators
subtitle: Walter Isaacson
content: The Innovators: How a Group of Hackers, Geniuses, and Geeks Created the Digital Revolution is a book by Walter Isaacson, published in 2014. It chronicles the history of computing and the Internet, from the early pioneers like Ada Lovelace and Alan Turing to modern innovators such as Steve Jobs and Bill Gates. Isaacson explores the collaborative and often chaotic nature of innovation, highlighting the contributions of teamwork, creativity, and perseverance in shaping the digital world we live in today.
